word:
Providence has administered, in this case, a terrible rebuke 
                                                                           675
for the conduct of those who did not take this stranger in. She was not really a stranger. By reputation she was known, and yet she was not taken in. Many will feel sad as they think of Sister More as she stood in Battle Creek, begging a home there with the people of her choice. And as they, in imagination, follow her to Chicago, to borrow money to meet the expenses of the journey to her final resting place,--and when they think of that grave in Leelenaw County, where rests this precious outcast,--God pity those who are guilty in her case.
